p: Protect sensitive data in transit over untrusted networks using TLS with valid certificates.
Using TLS with valid certificates to protect sensitive data in transit prevents this data from being sniffed or tampered with.
To protect sensitive data in transit over untrusted networks using TLS:
ol:
Purchase valid TLS certificates. You may purchase a valid TLS key from VeriSign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the TLS certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file. Make sure the certificate matches all domains used by the application.
 Identify code that sends data over untrusted networks. It is more practical to secure all communications that to separate the communications that contain sensitive data from those that don't. Make a spreadsheet of all the code that uses networks to transmit data.
 Use TLS to protect data in transit. If the code that sends data over the network doesn't already, modify it to only use TLS sockets with valid certificates for network communications.
li: Purchase valid TLS certificates. You may purchase a valid TLS key from VeriSign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the TLS certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file. Make sure the certificate matches all domains used by the application.

Identify code that sends data over untrusted networks. It is more practical to secure all communications that to separate the communications that contain sensitive data from those that don't. Make a spreadsheet of all the code that uses networks to transmit data.
Use TLS to protect data in transit. If the code that sends data over the network doesn't already, modify it to only use TLS sockets with valid certificates for network communications.
strong: Identify code that sends data over untrusted networks.
Use TLS to protect data in transit.

html:
What to Do

Protect sensitive data in transit over untrusted networks using TLS with valid certificates.

Why

Using TLS with valid certificates to protect sensitive data in transit prevents this data from being sniffed or tampered with.

What to Do

To protect sensitive data in transit over untrusted networks using TLS:

  1. Purchase valid TLS certificates. You may purchase a valid TLS key from VeriSign, Thawte, or your web hosting provider. Follow the vendor's instructions for purchasing the TLS certificate. The certificate is usually a .cer file. Make sure the certificate matches all domains used by the application.
  2. Identify code that sends data over untrusted networks. It is more practical to secure all communications that to separate the communications that contain sensitive data from those that don't. Make a spreadsheet of all the code that uses networks to transmit data.
  3. Use TLS to protect data in transit. If the code that sends data over the network doesn't already, modify it to only use TLS sockets with valid certificates for network communications.
